supporting_text: The NAP includes strategies to prevent and control infections associated with health care and to strengthen the national surveillance system for antimicrobial resistance.
The NAP outlines actions to prevent and control infections in animal production and companion animals.
The NAP emphasizes the importance of environmental factors in the emergence and spread of antimicrobial resistance.
The NAP includes strategies to regulate and monitor the use of antimicrobials in agriculture.
The NAP mentions the need for annual or biannual operational plans to evaluate the activities proposed.
The NAP outlines specific objectives and actions to be implemented within the 2021-2025 timeframe.
The document does not specify any budget allocation for the strategies outlined.
The NAP establishes a multisectoral committee for AMR coordination involving various ministries.
The NAP promotes the incorporation of AMR topics into educational curricula and training programs for health professionals.
The NAP includes strategies for public awareness campaigns to inform the community about the responsible use of antimicrobials.
The NAP acknowledges collaboration with international organizations such as WHO, FAO, and OIE.
The NAP emphasizes the development of an integrated surveillance system for AMR.
The NAP includes objectives to strengthen the capacity for detecting and reporting antimicrobial resistance.
The NAP outlines strategies for preventing and controlling infections in health care settings.
The NAP includes actions to regulate the use of antimicrobials in animal health according to OIE standards.
The NAP includes regulations for the prescription and distribution of antimicrobials.
The NAP aims to strengthen the regulatory framework for the use of antimicrobials.
The NAP includes measures to promote the rational use of antibiotics in health care.
The NAP encourages participation in international research initiatives related to AMR.
